To illustrate this Revius⁴¹ quotes a manuscript to show that the bridge was begun on 1 Aug. 1482 and opened to traffic on 16 March 14833 and thus there is an obvious contradiction to the date given above. But the care with which the town of Deventer has cherished its archives enables the difficulty to be disposed of· The accounts of the bridge contractor are still to be seen preserved in their original form on seventeen folio pages; and they run from 15 June 1482 to 1487. It is clear, therefore, that the bridge must have been opened to traffic before it was actually completed; and with work upon it still going on in 1484 Erasmus’ description of ἢ as unfinished is quite justified.
